creator: kevin cunanan chappelle
title: SPECTER
description: SPECTER evokes both the vividness and the chaos of the mind's eye. the restless arrangement of images engulfs you: photographs, ai-generated imagery, and glitchy fragments phase into each other and refuse to fully resolve. nothing unfolds in order. you encounter moments the way you might remember them‚Äîout of sequence and perhaps half-fiction, yet charged with feeling. between flashes of dread and sudden tenderness, its fractured narrative is told through the images and their metatext as if through a stream of consciousness. this is a space where feeling lingers longer than fact.

creator: Meg Wilson
title: Digital Compost Heap
description:
This interactive work is built from a USB archive of images taken between roughly 2004 and 2010 ‚Äî early digital photographs that were never meant to be preserved as history. They are fragments of an uncurated life. The system organizes them through the logic of compost.

Brown Matter forms the base layer. These are structural, quiet images: spatial, textural, often incidental. They resist attention and break down slowly, creating atmosphere and ground. Green Matter carries emotional charge. Selfies, portraits, and social moments from adolescence surface and dissolve more quickly. They are vivid, nitrogen-rich, and unstable ‚Äî images where identity was being performed and recorded at the same time. Cultural Spores drift through the field. Interface fragments, pop ephemera, and traces of early social media introduce the atmosphere of a specific era. They ferment the archive from within. Strange Growths appear intermittently: glitches, distortions, and anomalies that interrupt coherence and spread unpredictably.

As the cursor moves, digital spores activate and disturb the image field. Fragments emerge, overlap, fade, and degrade. Categories collapse into one another. Digital Compost Heap considers archival decay not as loss, but as transformation. Early digital memory, once stored as if permanent, becomes unstable material. Images soften, bleed, and erode. The archive is rotting.

creator: Kay Zeng
title: an apple for an Ô£ø.zip
description:
an apple for an Ô£ø is a small desktop folder using images of an apple i actually consumed, customized folder settings and folder action scripts, to remind myself of the immigrant agriculture labor behind this and other apples/crops and the difficulties they are facing.

you can download the folder at kayzeng.com/folder_practice and send it to someone else as a gift for their Ô£ø. instructions on how to make a circulatable dmg with all the custom settings preserved are documented on my site.

creator: Jackie Liu
title: diary2glitter
description: diary2glitter is a work-in-progress collection of excerpts from my daily Notes app diary, turned into glitter text using free, online glitter text creation tools. Since 2022 I've maintained a consistent daily practice of journaling, often being a dumping ground for my ruminations, therapy revelations, feral crashouts, and mundane todo lists. By glitterfy-ing snippets from my diary, I hope to elevate a writing practice that normally isn't so remarkable or publicly-presentable.

creator: Aurora D'Errico
title: Portrait of a lady on the internet
description: A self-portrait assembled from my Twitter bookmarks. Images are cropped into squares and re-arranged into multi-image grids, forming a visual archive of impulses, interests, and recurring aesthetics. Rather than representing the self directly, identity emerges through processes of selection, repetition, and re-formatting. Conceived as a printed publication, the project is now re-circulated online for this final showcase through a scan of the physical work. This work is still in progress.

creator: luci vd
title: nintendo image archive
description: my project is an archive of imperfect pictures hidden in my Nintendo DSI/3DS between the years of 2008-2012. it is an unfiltered journey into my day-to-day life, and shows an accurate representation of the things that mattered to me - the things i chose as a 10 year old to document for my future self. these images transport me to a time of creating with no care, with no audience, no expectations. i never imagined that the images i was creating would ever leave the realm of my DS to be shown online. i think it is the result of squeezing out my entire being and filtering it 10x over to its purest form.

creator: Yuemin Huang
title: Copy & Originality
description:
Play a game. Each block is one pixel. Words = my feeling toward the color of that pixel.

This small project was created under the theme Copy Cat. It explores low-resolution imagery, the relationship between text and image, and the tension between imagination and originality. For me, it is an experiment in ‚Äúwriting a novel with images‚Äù ‚Äî where colors become narrative fragments, and words transform pixels into stories.

I use AI tools and turned this piece into an interactive game. I invite others to participate and experience this process of generating an ‚Äúimage-novel‚Äù together ‚Äî navigating between coloring and naming, and reconsidering the relationship between image, language, and authorship.

creator: jennywhen26
title: my"space" 2.0
description: welcome to my space online ‚Äî a (not-quite) one-to-one replica of my apartment, equal parts here and now, and what could be .ñ•î ›Å Àñ÷¥üõ∏‡ºÑÀñ¬∞.

creator: salvarez
title: american faces
description: a browser-based experiment staged at mount rushmore. spurred by thoughts about immortalizing yourself in stone, storing yourself in databases, and being woven into the fabric of digital colonialism itself. best viewed on Firefox-based and Chromium-based browsers.

creator: Brittany Orlando
title: A Town Called Street
description: Brittany Orlando is a girl from a town called Street.

creator: RHYSQUAD
title: manujin's restored folder
description: RHYSQUAD is a digital restoration team focused on files, contemporary art, and discovering niche, esoteric, beautiful artists (rare!). We encountered manujin‚Äôs folder after he submitted several restoration requests believing he met our criteria. Through the recovery of his deleted archives, we learned they were produced as part of Molly Soda‚Äôs course at SFPC. The files are now available for download. Please visit our shop and take our curatorial survey ‚Äî you might be next!

creator: Maria Agra
title: Digital Landscapes
description:
This project takes the form of a booklet that opens in a 16:9 format, echoing the proportions of the screen. It focuses on landscapes we often encounter not in person, but as desktop wallpapers: vast, awe-inspiring scenes rendered into digital backdrops. Starting as digital files, these landscapes are processed and distorted, then brought back into the physical world and reworked by hand with coloured pencils and embroidery.

The work reflects on the shifting status of these images of nature as they oscillate between digital and physical forms, questioning how the screen both frames and distances our experience of the sublime.
